{"step_by_step_thinking": "Adrenocorticosteroids, also known as corticosteroids, are hormones produced by the adrenal glands. When produced in excess, they can lead to a number of health problems. One of the most common side effects of excess corticosteroids is osteoporosis, a condition that weakens bones and makes them more prone to fracture. Osteosclerosis, on the other hand, is a condition that involves the hardening or abnormal density of bone, which is not typically associated with excess corticosteroids. Osteochondritis is a condition that affects the joints and is also not typically associated with excess corticosteroids.", "answer_choice": "A"}
